intro: Jateorhiza lobata, commonly known as the broad-leafed jateorhiza, is a perennial herb native to the wetlands and marshy areas of eastern North America. It belongs to the family Iridaceae, which includes irises and related plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces striking violet to blue flowers with three petals and three sepals. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and colonize wetland habitats effectively. Jateorhiza lobata plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
